verses.name: Matthew 16:6
verses.text: "Be careful," Jesus said to them. "Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees."

verses.name: Matthew 16:7
verses.text: They discussed this among themselves and said, "It is because we didn't bring any bread."

verses.name: Matthew 16:8
verses.text: Aware of their discussion, Jesus asked, "You of little faith, why are you talking among yourselves about having no bread?

verses.name: Matthew 16:9
verses.text: Do you still not understand? Don't you remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many basketfuls you gathered?

verses.name: Matthew 16:10
verses.text: Or the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many basketfuls you gathered?

verses.name: Matthew 16:11
verses.text: How is it you don't understand that I was not talking to you about bread? But be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees."

verses.name: Matthew 16:12
verses.text: Then they understood that he was not telling them to guard against the yeast used in bread, but against the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

verses.name: Matthew 16:13
verses.text: When Jesus came to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, "Who do people say the Son of Man is?"

verses.name: Matthew 16:14
verses.text: They replied, "Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, Jeremiah or one of the prophets."

verses.name: Matthew 16:15
verses.text: "But what about you?" he asked. "Who do you say I am?"

verses.name: Matthew 16:16
verses.text: Simon Peter answered, "You are the Christ, the Son of the living God."

verses.name: Matthew 16:17
verses.text: Jesus replied, "Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, for this was not revealed to you by man, but by my Father in heaven.

verses.name: Matthew 16:18
verses.text: And I tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not overcome it.

verses.name: Matthew 16:19
verses.text: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven; whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven."

verses.name: Matthew 16:20
verses.text: Then he warned his disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Christ.

verses.name: Matthew 16:21
verses.text: From that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the elders, chief priests and teachers of the law, and that he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life.

verses.name: Matthew 16:22
verses.text: Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him. "Never, Lord!" he said. "This shall never happen to you!"

verses.name: Matthew 16:23
verses.text: Jesus turned and said to Peter, "Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me; you do not have in mind the things of God, but the things of men."

verses.name: Matthew 16:24
verses.text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, "If anyone would come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.

verses.name: Matthew 16:25
verses.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for me will find it.

verses.name: Matthew 16:26
verses.text: What good will it be for a man if he gains the whole world, yet forfeits his soul? Or what can a man give in exchange for his soul?

verses.name: Matthew 16:27
verses.text: For the Son of Man is going to come in his Father's glory with his angels, and then he will reward each person according to what he has done.

verses.name: Matthew 16:28
verses.text: I tell you the truth, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom."

verses.name: Matthew 17:1
verses.text: After six days Jesus took with him Peter, James and John the brother of James, and led them up a high mountain by themselves.

verses.name: Matthew 17:2
verses.text: There he was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and his clothes became as white as the light.

verses.name: Matthew 17:3
verses.text: Just then there appeared before them Moses and Elijah, talking with Jesus.

verses.name: Matthew 17:4
verses.text: Peter said to Jesus, "Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you wish, I will put up three shelters--one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah."

verses.name: Matthew 17:5
verses.text: While he was still speaking, a bright cloud enveloped them, and a voice from the cloud said, "This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased. Listen to him!"

verses.name: Matthew 17:6
verses.text: When the disciples heard this, they fell facedown to the ground, terrified.

verses.name: Matthew 17:7
verses.text: But Jesus came and touched them. "Get up," he said. "Don't be afraid."

verses.name: Matthew 17:8
verses.text: When they looked up, they saw no one except Jesus.

verses.name: Matthew 17:9
verses.text: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus instructed them, "Don't tell anyone what you have seen, until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead."

verses.name: Matthew 17:10
verses.text: The disciples asked him, "Why then do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must come first?"

verses.name: Matthew 17:11
verses.text: Jesus replied, "To be sure, Elijah comes and will restore all things.

verses.name: Matthew 17:12
verses.text: But I tell you, Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but have done to him everything they wished. In the same way the Son of Man is going to suffer at their hands."

verses.name: Matthew 17:13
verses.text: Then the disciples understood that he was talking to them about John the Baptist.

verses.name: Matthew 17:14
verses.text: When they came to the crowd, a man approached Jesus and knelt before him.

verses.name: Matthew 17:15
verses.text: "Lord, have mercy on my son," he said. "He has seizures and is suffering greatly. He often falls into the fire or into the water.

verses.name: Matthew 17:16
verses.text: I brought him to your disciples, but they could not heal him."

verses.name: Matthew 17:17
verses.text: "O unbelieving and perverse generation," Jesus replied, "how long shall I stay with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring the boy here to me."

verses.name: Matthew 17:18
verses.text: Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of the boy, and he was healed from that moment.

verses.name: Matthew 17:19
verses.text: Then the disciples came to Jesus in private and asked, "Why couldn't we drive it out?"

verses.name: Matthew 17:20
verses.text: He replied, "Because you have so little faith. I tell you the truth, if you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, 'Move from here to there' and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you."

verses.name: Matthew 17:21
verses.text: See Footnote

verses.name: Matthew 17:22
verses.text: When they came together in Galilee, he said to them, "The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men.

verses.name: Matthew 17:23
verses.text: They will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised to life." And the disciples were filled with grief.

verses.name: Matthew 17:24
verses.text: After Jesus and his disciples arrived in Capernaum, the collectors of the two-drachma tax came to Peter and asked, "Doesn't your teacher pay the temple tax?"

verses.name: Matthew 17:25
verses.text: "Yes, he does," he replied. When Peter came into the house, Jesus was the first to speak. "What do you think, Simon?" he asked. "From whom do the kings of the earth collect duty and taxes--from their own sons or from others?"

verses.name: Matthew 17:26
verses.text: "From others," Peter answered.

verses.name: Matthew 17:27
verses.text: "Then the sons are exempt," Jesus said to him. "But so that we may not offend them, go to the lake and throw out your line. Take the first fish you catch; open its mouth and you will find a four-drachma coin. Take it and give it to them for my tax and yours."

verses.name: Matthew 18:1
verses.text: At that time the disciples came to Jesus and asked, "Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?"

verses.name: Matthew 18:2
verses.text: He called a little child and had him stand among them.

verses.name: Matthew 18:3
verses.text: And he said: "I tell you the truth, unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Matthew 18:4
verses.text: Therefore, whoever humbles himself like this child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Matthew 18:5
verses.text: "And whoever welcomes a little child like this in my name welcomes me.

verses.name: Matthew 18:6
verses.text: But if anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him to have a large millstone hung around his neck and to be drowned in the depths of the sea.

verses.name: Matthew 18:7
verses.text: "Woe to the world because of the things that cause people to sin! Such things must come, but woe to the man through whom they come!

verses.name: Matthew 18:8
verses.text: If your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life maimed or crippled than to have two hands or two feet and be thrown into eternal fire.

verses.name: Matthew 18:9
verses.text: And if your eye causes you to sin, gouge it out and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.

verses.name: Matthew 18:10
verses.text: "See that you do not look down on one of these little ones. For I tell you that their angels in heaven always see the face of my Father in heaven.

verses.name: Matthew 18:11
verses.text: See Footnote

verses.name: Matthew 18:12
verses.text: "What do you think? If a man owns a hundred sheep, and one of them wanders away, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the hills and go to look for the one that wandered off?

verses.name: Matthew 18:13
verses.text: And if he finds it, I tell you the truth, he is happier about that one sheep than about the ninety-nine that did not wander off.

verses.name: Matthew 18:14
verses.text: In the same way your Father in heaven is not willing that any of these little ones should be lost.

verses.name: Matthew 18:15
verses.text: "If your brother sins against you, go and show him his fault, just between the two of you. If he listens to you, you have won your brother over.

verses.name: Matthew 18:16
verses.text: But if he will not listen, take one or two others along, so that 'every matter may be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.'

verses.name: Matthew 18:17
verses.text: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church; and if he refuses to listen even to the church, treat him as you would a pagan or a tax collector.

verses.name: Matthew 18:18
verses.text: "I tell you the truth, whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.

verses.name: Matthew 18:19
verses.text: "Again, I tell you that if two of you on earth agree about anything you ask for, it will be done for you by my Father in heaven.

verses.name: Matthew 18:20
verses.text: For where two or three come together in my name, there am I with them."

verses.name: Matthew 18:21
verses.text: Then Peter came to Jesus and asked, "Lord, how many times shall I forgive my brother when he sins against me? Up to seven times?"

verses.name: Matthew 18:22
verses.text: Jesus answered, "I tell you, not seven times, but seventy-seven times.

verses.name: Matthew 18:23
verses.text: "Therefore, the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants.

verses.name: Matthew 18:24
verses.text: As he began the settlement, a man who owed him ten thousand talents was brought to him.

verses.name: Matthew 18:25
verses.text: Since he was not able to pay, the master ordered that he and his wife and his children and all that he had be sold to repay the debt.

verses.name: Matthew 18:26
verses.text: "The servant fell on his knees before him. 'Be patient with me,' he begged, 'and I will pay back everything.'

verses.name: Matthew 18:27
verses.text: The servant's master took pity on him, canceled the debt and let him go.

verses.name: Matthew 18:28
verses.text: "But when that servant went out, he found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred denarii. He grabbed him and began to choke him. 'Pay back what you owe me!' he demanded.

verses.name: Matthew 18:29
verses.text: "His fellow servant fell to his knees and begged him, 'Be patient with me, and I will pay you back.'

verses.name: Matthew 18:30
verses.text: "But he refused. Instead, he went off and had the man thrown into prison until he could pay the debt.

verses.name: Matthew 18:31
verses.text: When the other servants saw what had happened, they were greatly distressed and went and told their master everything that had happened.

verses.name: Matthew 18:32
verses.text: "Then the master called the servant in. 'You wicked servant,' he said, 'I canceled all that debt of yours because you begged me to.

verses.name: Matthew 18:33
verses.text: Shouldn't you have had mercy on your fellow servant just as I had on you?'

verses.name: Matthew 18:34
verses.text: In anger his master turned him over to the jailers to be tortured, until he should pay back all he owed.

verses.name: Matthew 18:35
verses.text: "This is how my heavenly Father will treat each of you unless you forgive your brother from your heart."

verses.name: Matthew 19:1
verses.text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, he left Galilee and went into the region of Judea to the other side of the Jordan.

verses.name: Matthew 19:2
verses.text: Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.

verses.name: Matthew 19:3
verses.text: Some Pharisees came to him to test him. They asked, "Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any and every reason?"

verses.name: Matthew 19:4
verses.text: "Haven't you read," he replied, "that at the beginning the Creator 'made them male and female,'

verses.name: Matthew 19:5
verses.text: and said, 'For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and the two will become one flesh'?

verses.name: Matthew 19:6
verses.text: So they are no longer two, but one. Therefore what God has joined together, let man not separate."

verses.name: Matthew 19:7
verses.text: "Why then," they asked, "did Moses command that a man give his wife a certificate of divorce and send her away?"

verses.name: Matthew 19:8
verses.text: Jesus replied, "Moses permitted you to divorce your wives because your hearts were hard. But it was not this way from the beginning.

verses.name: Matthew 19:9
verses.text: I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife, except for marital unfaithfulness, and marries another woman commits adultery."

verses.name: Matthew 19:10
verses.text: The disciples said to him, "If this is the situation between a husband and wife, it is better not to marry."

verses.name: Matthew 19:11
verses.text: Jesus replied, "Not everyone can accept this word, but only those to whom it has been given.

verses.name: Matthew 19:12
verses.text: For some are eunuchs because they were born that way; others were made that way by men; and others have renounced marriage because of the kingdom of heaven. The one who can accept this should accept it."

verses.name: Matthew 19:13
verses.text: Then little children were brought to Jesus for him to place his hands on them and pray for them. But the disciples rebuked those who brought them.

verses.name: Matthew 19:14
verses.text: Jesus said, "Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these."

verses.name: Matthew 19:15
verses.text: When he had placed his hands on them, he went on from there.

verses.name: Matthew 19:16
verses.text: Now a man came up to Jesus and asked, "Teacher, what good thing must I do to get eternal life?"

verses.name: Matthew 19:17
verses.text: "Why do you ask me about what is good?" Jesus replied. "There is only One who is good. If you want to enter life, obey the commandments."

verses.name: Matthew 19:18
verses.text: "Which ones?" the man inquired.

verses.name: Matthew 19:19
verses.text: Jesus replied, "'Do not murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not give false testimony, honor your father and mother,' and 'love your neighbor as yourself.'"

verses.name: Matthew 19:20
verses.text: "All these I have kept," the young man said. "What do I still lack?"

verses.name: Matthew 19:21
verses.text: Jesus answered, "If you want to be perfect, go, sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me."

verses.name: Matthew 19:22
verses.text: When the young man heard this, he went away sad, because he had great wealth.

verses.name: Matthew 19:23
verses.text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, "I tell you the truth, it is hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Matthew 19:24
verses.text: Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God."

verses.name: Matthew 19:25
verses.text: When the disciples heard this, they were greatly astonished and asked, "Who then can be saved?"

verses.name: Matthew 19:26
verses.text: Jesus looked at them and said, "With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible."

verses.name: Matthew 19:27
verses.text: Peter answered him, "We have left everything to follow you! What then will there be for us?"

verses.name: Matthew 19:28
verses.text: Jesus said to them, "I tell you the truth, at the renewal of all things, when the Son of Man sits on his glorious throne, you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.name: Matthew 19:29
verses.text: And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or fields for my sake will receive a hundred times as much and will inherit eternal life.

verses.name: Matthew 19:30
verses.text: But many who are first will be last, and many who are last will be first.

verses.name: Matthew 20:1
verses.text: "For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire men to work in his vineyard.

verses.name: Matthew 20:2
verses.text: He agreed to pay them a denarius for the day and sent them into his vineyard.

verses.name: Matthew 20:3
verses.text: "About the third hour he went out and saw others standing in the marketplace doing nothing.

verses.name: Matthew 20:4
verses.text: He told them, 'You also go and work in my vineyard, and I will pay you whatever is right.'

verses.name: Matthew 20:5
verses.text: So they went.

verses.name: Matthew 20:6
verses.text: "He went out again about the sixth hour and the ninth hour and did the same thing. About the eleventh hour he went out and found still others standing around. He asked them, 'Why have you been standing here all day long doing nothing?'

verses.name: Matthew 20:7
verses.text: "'Because no one has hired us,' they answered. "He said to them, 'You also go and work in my vineyard.'

verses.name: Matthew 20:8
verses.text: "When evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, 'Call the workers and pay them their wages, beginning with the last ones hired and going on to the first.'

verses.name: Matthew 20:9
verses.text: "The workers who were hired about the eleventh hour came and each received a denarius.

verses.name: Matthew 20:10
verses.text: So when those came who were hired first, they expected to receive more. But each one of them also received a denarius.

verses.name: Matthew 20:11
verses.text: When they received it, they began to grumble against the landowner.

verses.name: Matthew 20:12
verses.text: 'These men who were hired last worked only one hour,' they said, 'and you have made them equal to us who have borne the burden of the work and the heat of the day.'

verses.name: Matthew 20:13
verses.text: "But he answered one of them, 'Friend, I am not being unfair to you. Didn't you agree to work for a denarius?

verses.name: Matthew 20:14
verses.text: Take your pay and go. I want to give the man who was hired last the same as I gave you.

verses.name: Matthew 20:15
verses.text: Don't I have the right to do what I want with my own money? Or are you envious because I am generous?'

verses.name: Matthew 20:16
verses.text: "So the last will be first, and the first will be last."

verses.name: Matthew 20:17
verses.text: Now as Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside and said to them,

verses.name: Matthew 20:18
verses.text: "We are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and the teachers of the law. They will condemn him to death

verses.name: Matthew 20:19
verses.text: and will turn him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and flogged and crucified. On the third day he will be raised to life!"

verses.name: Matthew 20:20
verses.text: Then the mother of Zebedee's sons came to Jesus with her sons and, kneeling down, asked a favor of him.

verses.name: Matthew 20:21
verses.text: "What is it you want?" he asked. She said, "Grant that one of these two sons of mine may sit at your right and the other at your left in your kingdom."

verses.name: Matthew 20:22
verses.text: "You don't know what you are asking," Jesus said to them. "Can you drink the cup I am going to drink?We can," they answered.

verses.name: Matthew 20:23
verses.text: Jesus said to them, "You will indeed drink from my cup, but to sit at my right or left is not for me to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared by my Father."

verses.name: Matthew 20:24
verses.text: When the ten heard about this, they were indignant with the two brothers.

verses.name: Matthew 20:25
verses.text: Jesus called them together and said, "You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their high officials exercise authority over them.

verses.name: Matthew 20:26
verses.text: Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,

verses.name: Matthew 20:27
verses.text: and whoever wants to be first must be your slave--

verses.name: Matthew 20:28
verses.text: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many."

verses.name: Matthew 20:29
verses.text: As Jesus and his disciples were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed him.

verses.name: Matthew 20:30
verses.text: Two blind men were sitting by the roadside, and when they heard that Jesus was going by, they shouted, "Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!"

verses.name: Matthew 20:31
verses.text: The crowd rebuked them and told them to be quiet, but they shouted all the louder, "Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!"

verses.name: Matthew 20:32
verses.text: Jesus stopped and called them. "What do you want me to do for you?" he asked.

verses.name: Matthew 20:33
verses.text: "Lord," they answered, "we want our sight."

verses.name: Matthew 20:34
verses.text: Jesus had compassion on them and touched their eyes. Immediately they received their sight and followed him.

verses.name: Matthew 21:1
verses.text: As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples,

verses.name: Matthew 21:2
verses.text: saying to them, "Go to the village ahead of you, and at once you will find a donkey tied there, with her colt by her. Untie them and bring them to me.

verses.name: Matthew 21:3
verses.text: If anyone says anything to you, tell him that the Lord needs them, and he will send them right away."

verses.name: Matthew 21:4
verses.text: This took place to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet:

verses.name: Matthew 21:5
verses.text: "Say to the Daughter of Zion, 'See, your king comes to you, gentle and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.'"

verses.name: Matthew 21:6
verses.text: The disciples went and did as Jesus had instructed them.

verses.name: Matthew 21:7
verses.text: They brought the donkey and the colt, placed their cloaks on them, and Jesus sat on them.

verses.name: Matthew 21:8
verses.text: A very large crowd spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.

verses.name: Matthew 21:9
verses.text: The crowds that went ahead of him and those that followed shouted, "Hosanna to the Son of David!Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!Hosanna in the highest!"

verses.name: Matthew 21:10
verses.text: When Jesus entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred and asked, "Who is this?"

verses.name: Matthew 21:11
verses.text: The crowds answered, "This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee."

verses.name: Matthew 21:12
verses.text: Jesus entered the temple area and drove out all who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves.

verses.name: Matthew 21:13
verses.text: "It is written," he said to them, "'My house will be called a house of prayer,' but you are making it a 'den of robbers.'"

verses.name: Matthew 21:14
verses.text: The blind and the lame came to him at the temple, and he healed them.

verses.name: Matthew 21:15
verses.text: But when the chief priests and the teachers of the law saw the wonderful things he did and the children shouting in the temple area, "Hosanna to the Son of David," they were indignant.

verses.name: Matthew 21:16
verses.text: "Do you hear what these children are saying?" they asked him. "Yes," replied Jesus, "have you never read, "'From the lips of children and infants you have ordained praise'?"

verses.name: Matthew 21:17
verses.text: And he left them and went out of the city to Bethany, where he spent the night.

verses.name: Matthew 21:18
verses.text: Early in the morning, as he was on his way back to the city, he was hungry.

verses.name: Matthew 21:19
verses.text: Seeing a fig tree by the road, he went up to it but found nothing on it except leaves. Then he said to it, "May you never bear fruit again!" Immediately the tree withered.

verses.name: Matthew 21:20
verses.text: When the disciples saw this, they were amazed. "How did the fig tree wither so quickly?" they asked.

verses.name: Matthew 21:21
verses.text: Jesus replied, "I tell you the truth, if you have faith and do not doubt, not only can you do what was done to the fig tree, but also you can say to this mountain, 'Go, throw yourself into the sea,' and it will be done.

verses.name: Matthew 21:22
verses.text: If you believe, you will receive whatever you ask for in prayer."

verses.name: Matthew 21:23
verses.text: Jesus entered the temple courts, and, while he was teaching, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him. "By what authority are you doing these things?" they asked. "And who gave you this authority?"

verses.name: Matthew 21:24
verses.text: Jesus replied, "I will also ask you one question. If you answer me, I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

verses.name: Matthew 21:25
verses.text: John's baptism--where did it come from? Was it from heaven, or from men?"

verses.name: Matthew 21:26
verses.text: They discussed it among themselves and said, "If we say, 'From heaven,' he will ask, 'Then why didn't you believe him?' But if we say, 'From men'--we are afraid of the people, for they all hold that John was a prophet."

verses.name: Matthew 21:27
verses.text: So they answered Jesus, "We don't know." Then he said, "Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

verses.name: Matthew 21:28
verses.text: "What do you think? There was a man who had two sons. He went to the first and said, 'Son, go and work today in the vineyard.'

verses.name: Matthew 21:29
verses.text: "'I will not,' he answered, but later he changed his mind and went.

verses.name: Matthew 21:30
verses.text: "Then the father went to the other son and said the same thing. He answered, 'I will, sir,' but he did not go.

verses.name: Matthew 21:31
verses.text: "Which of the two did what his father wanted?The first," they answered.

verses.name: Matthew 21:32
verses.text: Jesus said to them, "I tell you the truth, the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering the kingdom of God ahead of you. For John came to you to show you the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes did. And even after you saw this, you did not repent and believe him.

verses.name: Matthew 21:33
verses.text: "Listen to another parable: There was a landowner who planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a winepress in it and built a watchtower. Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and went away on a journey.

verses.name: Matthew 21:34
verses.text: When the harvest time approached, he sent his servants to the tenants to collect his fruit.

verses.name: Matthew 21:35
verses.text: "The tenants seized his servants; they beat one, killed another, and stoned a third.

verses.name: Matthew 21:36
verses.text: Then he sent other servants to them, more than the first time, and the tenants treated them the same way.

verses.name: Matthew 21:37
verses.text: Last of all, he sent his son to them. 'They will respect my son,' he said.

verses.name: Matthew 21:38
verses.text: "But when the tenants saw the son, they said to each other, 'This is the heir. Come, let's kill him and take his inheritance.'

verses.name: Matthew 21:39
verses.text: So they took him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.

verses.name: Matthew 21:40
verses.text: "Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those tenants?"

verses.name: Matthew 21:41
verses.text: "He will bring those wretches to a wretched end," they replied, "and he will rent the vineyard to other tenants, who will give him his share of the crop at harvest time."

verses.name: Matthew 21:42
verses.text: Jesus said to them, "Have you never read in the Scriptures: "'The stone the builders rejected has become the capstone; the Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes'?

verses.name: Matthew 21:43
verses.text: "Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.

verses.name: Matthew 21:44
verses.text: He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom it falls will be crushed."

verses.name: Matthew 21:45
verses.text: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard Jesus' parables, they knew he was talking about them.

verses.name: Matthew 21:46
verses.text: They looked for a way to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowd because the people held that he was a prophet.

verses.name: Matthew 22:1
verses.text: Jesus spoke to them again in parables, saying:

verses.name: Matthew 22:2
verses.text: "The kingdom of heaven is like a king who prepared a wedding banquet for his son.

verses.name: Matthew 22:3
verses.text: He sent his servants to those who had been invited to the banquet to tell them to come, but they refused to come.

verses.name: Matthew 22:4
verses.text: "Then he sent some more servants and said, 'Tell those who have been invited that I have prepared my dinner: My oxen and fattened cattle have been butchered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet.'

verses.name: Matthew 22:5
verses.text: "But they paid no attention and went off--one to his field, another to his business.

verses.name: Matthew 22:6
verses.text: The rest seized his servants, mistreated them and killed them.

verses.name: Matthew 22:7
verses.text: The king was enraged. He sent his army and destroyed those murderers and burned their city.

verses.name: Matthew 22:8
verses.text: "Then he said to his servants, 'The wedding banquet is ready, but those I invited did not deserve to come.

verses.name: Matthew 22:9
verses.text: Go to the street corners and invite to the banquet anyone you find.'

verses.name: Matthew 22:10
verses.text: So the servants went out into the streets and gathered all the people they could find, both good and bad, and the wedding hall was filled with guests.

verses.name: Matthew 22:11
verses.text: "But when the king came in to see the guests, he noticed a man there who was not wearing wedding clothes.

verses.name: Matthew 22:12
verses.text: 'Friend,' he asked, 'how did you get in here without wedding clothes?' The man was speechless.

verses.name: Matthew 22:13
verses.text: "Then the king told the attendants, 'Tie him hand and foot, and throw him outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'

verses.name: Matthew 22:14
verses.text: "For many are invited, but few are chosen."

verses.name: Matthew 22:15
verses.text: Then the Pharisees went out and laid plans to trap him in his words.

verses.name: Matthew 22:16
verses.text: They sent their disciples to him along with the Herodians. "Teacher," they said, "we know you are a man of integrity and that you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. You aren't swayed by men, because you pay no attention to who they are.

verses.name: Matthew 22:17
verses.text: Tell us then, what is your opinion? Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?"

verses.name: Matthew 22:18
verses.text: But Jesus, knowing their evil intent, said, "You hypocrites, why are you trying to trap me?

verses.name: Matthew 22:19
verses.text: Show me the coin used for paying the tax." They brought him a denarius,

verses.name: Matthew 22:20
verses.text: and he asked them, "Whose portrait is this? And whose inscription?"

verses.name: Matthew 22:21
verses.text: "Caesar's," they replied. Then he said to them, "Give to Caesar what is Caesar's, and to God what is God's."

verses.name: Matthew 22:22
verses.text: When they heard this, they were amazed. So they left him and went away.

verses.name: Matthew 22:23
verses.text: That same day the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him with a question.

verses.name: Matthew 22:24
verses.text: "Teacher," they said, "Moses told us that if a man dies without having children, his brother must marry the widow and have children for him.

verses.name: Matthew 22:25
verses.text: Now there were seven brothers among us. The first one married and died, and since he had no children, he left his wife to his brother.

verses.name: Matthew 22:26
verses.text: The same thing happened to the second and third brother, right on down to the seventh.

verses.name: Matthew 22:27
verses.text: Finally, the woman died.

verses.name: Matthew 22:28
verses.text: Now then, at the resurrection, whose wife will she be of the seven, since all of them were married to her?"

verses.name: Matthew 22:29
verses.text: Jesus replied, "You are in error because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God.

verses.name: Matthew 22:30
verses.text: At the resurrection people will neither marry nor be given in marriage; they will be like the angels in heaven.

verses.name: Matthew 22:31
verses.text: But about the resurrection of the dead--have you not read what God said to you,

verses.name: Matthew 22:32
verses.text: 'I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob'? He is not the God of the dead but of the living."

verses.name: Matthew 22:33
verses.text: When the crowds heard this, they were astonished at his teaching.

verses.name: Matthew 22:34
verses.text: Hearing that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, the Pharisees got together.

verses.name: Matthew 22:35
verses.text: One of them, an expert in the law, tested him with this question:

verses.name: Matthew 22:36
verses.text: "Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the Law?"

verses.name: Matthew 22:37
verses.text: Jesus replied: "'Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.'

verses.name: Matthew 22:38
verses.text: This is the first and greatest commandment.

verses.name: Matthew 22:39
verses.text: And the second is like it: 'Love your neighbor as yourself.'

verses.name: Matthew 22:40
verses.text: All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments."

verses.name: Matthew 22:41
verses.text: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,

verses.name: Matthew 22:42
verses.text: "What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?The son of David," they replied.

verses.name: Matthew 22:43
verses.text: He said to them, "How is it then that David, speaking by the Spirit, calls him 'Lord'? For he says,

verses.name: Matthew 22:44
verses.text: "'The Lord said to my Lord: "Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet."'

verses.name: Matthew 22:45
verses.text: If then David calls him 'Lord,' how can he be his son?"

verses.name: Matthew 22:46
verses.text: No one could say a word in reply, and from that day on no one dared to ask him any more questions.

verses.name: Matthew 23:1
verses.text: Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples:

verses.name: Matthew 23:2
verses.text: "The teachers of the law and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat.

verses.name: Matthew 23:3
verses.text: So you must obey them and do everything they tell you. But do not do what they do, for they do not practice what they preach.

verses.name: Matthew 23:4
verses.text: They tie up heavy loads and put them on men's shoulders, but they themselves are not willing to lift a finger to move them.

verses.name: Matthew 23:5
verses.text: "Everything they do is done for men to see: They make their phylacteries wide and the tassels on their garments long;

verses.name: Matthew 23:6
verses.text: they love the place of honor at banquets and the most important seats in the synagogues;

verses.name: Matthew 23:7
verses.text: they love to be greeted in the marketplaces and to have men call them 'Rabbi.'

verses.name: Matthew 23:8
verses.text: "But you are not to be called 'Rabbi,' for you have only one Master and you are all brothers.

verses.name: Matthew 23:9
verses.text: And do not call anyone on earth 'father,' for you have one Father, and he is in heaven.

verses.name: Matthew 23:10
verses.text: Nor are you to be called 'teacher,' for you have one Teacher, the Christ.

verses.name: Matthew 23:11
verses.text: The greatest among you will be your servant.

verses.name: Matthew 23:12
verses.text: For whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.

verses.name: Matthew 23:13
verses.text: "Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You shut the kingdom of heaven in men's faces. You yourselves do not enter, nor will you let those enter who are trying to.

verses.name: Matthew 23:14
verses.text: See Footnote

verses.name: Matthew 23:15
verses.text: "Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You travel over land and sea to win a single convert, and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much a son of hell as you are.

verses.name: Matthew 23:16
verses.text: "Woe to you, blind guides! You say, 'If anyone swears by the temple, it means nothing; but if anyone swears by the gold of the temple, he is bound by his oath.'

verses.name: Matthew 23:17
verses.text: You blind fools! Which is greater: the gold, or the temple that makes the gold sacred?

verses.name: Matthew 23:18
verses.text: You also say, 'If anyone swears by the altar, it means nothing; but if anyone swears by the gift on it, he is bound by his oath.'

verses.name: Matthew 23:19
verses.text: You blind men! Which is greater: the gift, or the altar that makes the gift sacred?

verses.name: Matthew 23:20
verses.text: Therefore, he who swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.

verses.name: Matthew 23:21
verses.text: And he who swears by the temple swears by it and by the one who dwells in it.

verses.name: Matthew 23:22
verses.text: And he who swears by heaven swears by God's throne and by the one who sits on it.

verses.name: Matthew 23:23
verses.text: "Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You give a tenth of your spices--mint, dill and cummin. But you have neglected the more important matters of the law--justice, mercy and faithfulness. You should have practiced the latter, without neglecting the former.

verses.name: Matthew 23:24
verses.text: You blind guides! You strain out a gnat but swallow a camel.

verses.name: Matthew 23:25
verses.text: "Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.

verses.name: Matthew 23:26
verses.text: Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and dish, and then the outside also will be clean.

verses.name: Matthew 23:27
verses.text: "Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs, which look beautiful on the outside but on the inside are full of dead men's bones and everything unclean.

verses.name: Matthew 23:28
verses.text: In the same way, on the outside you appear to people as righteous but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.

verses.name: Matthew 23:29
verses.text: "Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous.

verses.name: Matthew 23:30
verses.text: And you say, 'If we had lived in the days of our forefathers, we would not have taken part with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.'

verses.name: Matthew 23:31
verses.text: So you testify against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.

verses.name: Matthew 23:32
verses.text: Fill up, then, the measure of the sin of your forefathers!

verses.name: Matthew 23:33
verses.text: "You snakes! You brood of vipers! How will you escape being condemned to hell?

verses.name: Matthew 23:34
verses.text: Therefore I am sending you prophets and wise men and teachers. Some of them you will kill and crucify; others you will flog in your synagogues and pursue from town to town.

verses.name: Matthew 23:35
verses.text: And so upon you will come all the righteous blood that has been shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berekiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.

verses.name: Matthew 23:36
verses.text: I tell you the truth, all this will come upon this generation.

verses.name: Matthew 23:37
verses.text: "O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing.

verses.name: Matthew 23:38
verses.text: Look, your house is left to you desolate.

verses.name: Matthew 23:39
verses.text: For I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, 'Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.'"

verses.name: Matthew 24:1
verses.text: Jesus left the temple and was walking away when his disciples came up to him to call his attention to its buildings.

verses.name: Matthew 24:2
verses.text: "Do you see all these things?" he asked. "I tell you the truth, not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down."

verses.name: Matthew 24:3
verses.text: As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately. "Tell us," they said, "when will this happen, and what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?"

verses.name: Matthew 24:4
verses.text: Jesus answered: "Watch out that no one deceives you.

verses.name: Matthew 24:5
verses.text: For many will come in my name, claiming, 'I am the Christ, 'and will deceive many.

verses.name: Matthew 24:6
verses.text: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars, but see to it that you are not alarmed. Such things must happen, but the end is still to come.

verses.name: Matthew 24:7
verses.text: Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be famines and earthquakes in various places.

verses.name: Matthew 24:8
verses.text: All these are the beginning of birth pains.

verses.name: Matthew 24:9
verses.text: "Then you will be handed over to be persecuted and put to death, and you will be hated by all nations because of me.

verses.name: Matthew 24:10
verses.text: At that time many will turn away from the faith and will betray and hate each other,

verses.name: Matthew 24:11
verses.text: and many false prophets will appear and deceive many people.

verses.name: Matthew 24:12
verses.text: Because of the increase of wickedness, the love of most will grow cold,

verses.name: Matthew 24:13
verses.text: but he who stands firm to the end will be saved.

verses.name: Matthew 24:14
verses.text: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.

verses.name: Matthew 24:15
verses.text: "So when you see standing in the holy place 'the abomination that causes desolation,' spoken of through the prophet Daniel--let the reader understand--

verses.name: Matthew 24:16
verses.text: then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

verses.name: Matthew 24:17
verses.text: Let no one on the roof of his house go down to take anything out of the house.

verses.name: Matthew 24:18
verses.text: Let no one in the field go back to get his cloak.

verses.name: Matthew 24:19
verses.text: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!

verses.name: Matthew 24:20
verses.text: Pray that your flight will not take place in winter or on the Sabbath.

verses.name: Matthew 24:21
verses.text: For then there will be great distress, unequaled from the beginning of the world until now--and never to be equaled again.

verses.name: Matthew 24:22
verses.text: If those days had not been cut short, no one would survive, but for the sake of the elect those days will be shortened.

verses.name: Matthew 24:23
verses.text: At that time if anyone says to you, 'Look, here is the Christ!' or, 'There he is!' do not believe it.

verses.name: Matthew 24:24
verses.text: For false Christs and false prophets will appear and perform great signs and miracles to deceive even the elect--if that were possible.

verses.name: Matthew 24:25
verses.text: See, I have told you ahead of time.

verses.name: Matthew 24:26
verses.text: "So if anyone tells you, 'There he is, out in the desert,' do not go out; or, 'Here he is, in the inner rooms,' do not believe it.

verses.name: Matthew 24:27
verses.text: For as lightning that comes from the east is visible even in the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

verses.name: Matthew 24:28
verses.text: Wherever there is a carcass, there the vultures will gather.

verses.name: Matthew 24:29
verses.text: "Immediately after the distress of those days "'the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.'

verses.name: Matthew 24:30
verses.text: "At that time the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky, and all the nations of the earth will mourn. They will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky, with power and great glory.

verses.name: Matthew 24:31
verses.text: And he will send his angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from one end of the heavens to the other.

verses.name: Matthew 24:32
verses.text: "Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.

verses.name: Matthew 24:33
verses.text: Even so, when you see all these things, you know that it is near, right at the door.

verses.name: Matthew 24:34
verses.text: I tell you the truth, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.

verses.name: Matthew 24:35
verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

verses.name: Matthew 24:36
verses.text: "No one knows about that day or hour, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

verses.name: Matthew 24:37
verses.text: As it was in the days of Noah, so it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.

verses.name: Matthew 24:38
verses.text: For in the days before the flood, people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, up to the day Noah entered the ark;

verses.name: Matthew 24:39
verses.text: and they knew nothing about what would happen until the flood came and took them all away. That is how it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.

verses.name: Matthew 24:40
verses.text: Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left.

verses.name: Matthew 24:41
verses.text: Two women will be grinding with a hand mill; one will be taken and the other left.

verses.name: Matthew 24:42
verses.text: "Therefore keep watch, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.

verses.name: Matthew 24:43
verses.text: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what time of night the thief was coming, he would have kept watch and would not have let his house be broken into.

verses.name: Matthew 24:44
verses.text: So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.

verses.name: Matthew 24:45
verses.text: "Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom the master has put in charge of the servants in his household to give them their food at the proper time?

verses.name: Matthew 24:46
verses.text: It will be good for that servant whose master finds him doing so when he returns.

verses.name: Matthew 24:47
verses.text: I tell you the truth, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.

verses.name: Matthew 24:48
verses.text: But suppose that servant is wicked and says to himself, 'My master is staying away a long time,'

verses.name: Matthew 24:49
verses.text: and he then begins to beat his fellow servants and to eat and drink with drunkards.

verses.name: Matthew 24:50
verses.text: The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of.

verses.name: Matthew 24:51
verses.text: He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

verses.name: Matthew 25:1
verses.text: "At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.

verses.name: Matthew 25:2
verses.text: Five of them were foolish and five were wise.

verses.name: Matthew 25:3
verses.text: The foolish ones took their lamps but did not take any oil with them.

verses.name: Matthew 25:4
verses.text: The wise, however, took oil in jars along with their lamps.

verses.name: Matthew 25:5
verses.text: The bridegroom was a long time in coming, and they all became drowsy and fell asleep.

verses.name: Matthew 25:6
verses.text: "At midnight the cry rang out: 'Here's the bridegroom! Come out to meet him!'

verses.name: Matthew 25:7
verses.text: "Then all the virgins woke up and trimmed their lamps.

verses.name: Matthew 25:8
verses.text: The foolish ones said to the wise, 'Give us some of your oil; our lamps are going out.'

verses.name: Matthew 25:9
verses.text: "'No,' they replied, 'there may not be enough for both us and you. Instead, go to those who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.'

verses.name: Matthew 25:10
verses.text: "But while they were on their way to buy the oil, the bridegroom arrived. The virgins who were ready went in with him to the wedding banquet. And the door was shut.

verses.name: Matthew 25:11
verses.text: "Later the others also came. 'Sir! Sir!' they said. 'Open the door for us!'

verses.name: Matthew 25:12
verses.text: "But he replied, 'I tell you the truth, I don't know you.'

verses.name: Matthew 25:13
verses.text: "Therefore keep watch, because you do not know the day or the hour.

verses.name: Matthew 25:14
verses.text: "Again, it will be like a man going on a journey, who called his servants and entrusted his property to them.

verses.name: Matthew 25:15
verses.text: To one he gave five talents of money, to another two talents, and to another one talent, each according to his ability. Then he went on his journey.

verses.name: Matthew 25:16
verses.text: The man who had received the five talents went at once and put his money to work and gained five more.

verses.name: Matthew 25:17
verses.text: So also, the one with the two talents gained two more.

verses.name: Matthew 25:18
verses.text: But the man who had received the one talent went off, dug a hole in the ground and hid his master's money.

verses.name: Matthew 25:19
verses.text: "After a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them.

verses.name: Matthew 25:20
verses.text: The man who had received the five talents brought the other five. 'Master,' he said, 'you entrusted me with five talents. See, I have gained five more.'

verses.name: Matthew 25:21
verses.text: "His master replied, 'Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master's happiness!'

verses.name: Matthew 25:22
verses.text: "The man with the two talents also came. 'Master,' he said, 'you entrusted me with two talents; see, I have gained two more.'

verses.name: Matthew 25:23
verses.text: "His master replied, 'Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master's happiness!'

verses.name: Matthew 25:24
verses.text: "Then the man who had received the one talent came. 'Master,' he said, 'I knew that you are a hard man, harvesting where you have not sown and gathering where you have not scattered seed.

verses.name: Matthew 25:25
verses.text: So I was afraid and went out and hid your talent in the ground. See, here is what belongs to you.'

verses.name: Matthew 25:26
verses.text: "His master replied, 'You wicked, lazy servant! So you knew that I harvest where I have not sown and gather where I have not scattered seed?

verses.name: Matthew 25:27
verses.text: Well then, you should have put my money on deposit with the bankers, so that when I returned I would have received it back with interest.

verses.name: Matthew 25:28
verses.text: "'Take the talent from him and give it to the one who has the ten talents.

verses.name: Matthew 25:29
verses.text: For everyone who has will be given more, and he will have an abundance. Whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken from him.

verses.name: Matthew 25:30
verses.text: And throw that worthless servant outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'

verses.name: Matthew 25:31
verses.text: "When the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, he will sit on his throne in heavenly glory.

verses.name: Matthew 25:32
verses.text: All the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate the people one from another as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

verses.name: Matthew 25:33
verses.text: He will put the sheep on his right and the goats on his left.

verses.name: Matthew 25:34
verses.text: "Then the King will say to those on his right, 'Come, you who are blessed by my Father; take your inheritance, the kingdom prepared for you since the creation of the world.

verses.name: Matthew 25:35
verses.text: For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in,

verses.name: Matthew 25:36
verses.text: I needed clothes and you clothed me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to visit me.'

verses.name: Matthew 25:37
verses.text: "Then the righteous will answer him, 'Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink?

verses.name: Matthew 25:38
verses.text: When did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or needing clothes and clothe you?

verses.name: Matthew 25:39
verses.text: When did we see you sick or in prison and go to visit you?'

verses.name: Matthew 25:40
verses.text: "The King will reply, 'I tell you the truth, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did for me.'

verses.name: Matthew 25:41
verses.text: "Then he will say to those on his left, 'Depart from me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.

verses.name: Matthew 25:42
verses.text: For I was hungry and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink,

verses.name: Matthew 25:43
verses.text: I was a stranger and you did not invite me in, I needed clothes and you did not clothe me, I was sick and in prison and you did not look after me.'

verses.name: Matthew 25:44
verses.text: "They also will answer, 'Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or needing clothes or sick or in prison, and did not help you?'

verses.name: Matthew 25:45
verses.text: "He will reply, 'I tell you the truth, whatever you did not do for one of the least of these, you did not do for me.'

verses.name: Matthew 25:46
verses.text: "Then they will go away to eternal punishment, but the righteous to eternal life."

verses.name: Matthew 26:1
verses.text: When Jesus had finished saying all these things, he said to his disciples,

verses.name: Matthew 26:2
verses.text: "As you know, the Passover is two days away--and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified."

verses.name: Matthew 26:3
verses.text: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people assembled in the palace of the high priest, whose name was Caiaphas,

verses.name: Matthew 26:4
verses.text: and they plotted to arrest Jesus in some sly way and kill him.

verses.name: Matthew 26:5
verses.text: "But not during the Feast," they said, "or there may be a riot among the people."

verses.name: Matthew 26:6
verses.text: While Jesus was in Bethany in the home of a man known as Simon the Leper,

verses.name: Matthew 26:7
verses.text: a woman came to him with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume, which she poured on his head as he was reclining at the table.

verses.name: Matthew 26:8
verses.text: When the disciples saw this, they were indignant. "Why this waste?" they asked.

verses.name: Matthew 26:9
verses.text: "This perfume could have been sold at a high price and the money given to the poor."

verses.name: Matthew 26:10
verses.text: Aware of this, Jesus said to them, "Why are you bothering this woman? She has done a beautiful thing to me.

verses.name: Matthew 26:11
verses.text: The poor you will always have with you, but you will not always have me.

verses.name: Matthew 26:12
verses.text: When she poured this perfume on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.

verses.name: Matthew 26:13
verses.text: I tell you the truth, wherever this gospel is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told, in memory of her."

verses.name: Matthew 26:14
verses.text: Then one of the Twelve--the one called Judas Iscariot--went to the chief priests

verses.name: Matthew 26:15
verses.text: and asked, "What are you willing to give me if I hand him over to you?" So they counted out for him thirty silver coins.

verses.name: Matthew 26:16
verses.text: From then on Judas watched for an opportunity to hand him over.

verses.name: Matthew 26:17
verses.text: On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus and asked, "Where do you want us to make preparations for you to eat the Passover?"

verses.name: Matthew 26:18
verses.text: He replied, "Go into the city to a certain man and tell him, 'The Teacher says: My appointed time is near. I am going to celebrate the Passover with my disciples at your house.'"

verses.name: Matthew 26:19
verses.text: So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them and prepared the Passover.

verses.name: Matthew 26:20
verses.text: When evening came, Jesus was reclining at the table with the Twelve.

verses.name: Matthew 26:21
verses.text: And while they were eating, he said, "I tell you the truth, one of you will betray me."

verses.name: Matthew 26:22
verses.text: They were very sad and began to say to him one after the other, "Surely not I, Lord?"

verses.name: Matthew 26:23
verses.text: Jesus replied, "The one who has dipped his hand into the bowl with me will betray me.

verses.name: Matthew 26:24
verses.text: The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him. But woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man! It would be better for him if he had not been born."

verses.name: Matthew 26:25
verses.text: Then Judas, the one who would betray him, said, "Surely not I, Rabbi?" Jesus answered, "Yes, it is you."

verses.name: Matthew 26:26
verses.text: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, gave thanks and broke it, and gave it to his disciples, saying, "Take and eat; this is my body."

verses.name: Matthew 26:27
verses.text: Then he took the cup, gave thanks and offered it to them, saying, "Drink from it, all of you.

verses.name: Matthew 26:28
verses.text: This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.

verses.name: Matthew 26:29
verses.text: I tell you, I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it anew with you in my Father's kingdom."

verses.name: Matthew 26:30
verses.text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

verses.name: Matthew 26:31
verses.text: Then Jesus told them, "This very night you will all fall away on account of me, for it is written: "'I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.'

verses.name: Matthew 26:32
verses.text: But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee."

verses.name: Matthew 26:33
verses.text: Peter replied, "Even if all fall away on account of you, I never will."

verses.name: Matthew 26:34
verses.text: "I tell you the truth," Jesus answered, "this very night, before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times."

verses.name: Matthew 26:35
verses.text: But Peter declared, "Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you." And all the other disciples said the same.

verses.name: Matthew 26:36
verses.text: Then Jesus went with his disciples to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to them, "Sit here while I go over there and pray."

verses.name: Matthew 26:37
verses.text: He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee along with him, and he began to be sorrowful and troubled.

verses.name: Matthew 26:38
verses.text: Then he said to them, "My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with me."

verses.name: Matthew 26:39
verses.text: Going a little farther, he fell with his face to the ground and prayed, "My Father, if it is possible, may this cup be taken from me. Yet not as I will, but as you will."

verses.name: Matthew 26:40
verses.text: Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping. "Could you men not keep watch with me for one hour?" he asked Peter.

verses.name: Matthew 26:41
verses.text: "Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the body is weak."

verses.name: Matthew 26:42
verses.text: He went away a second time and prayed, "My Father, if it is not possible for this cup to be taken away unless I drink it, may your will be done."

verses.name: Matthew 26:43
verses.text: When he came back, he again found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy.

verses.name: Matthew 26:44
verses.text: So he left them and went away once more and prayed the third time, saying the same thing.

verses.name: Matthew 26:45
verses.text: Then he returned to the disciples and said to them, "Are you still sleeping and resting? Look, the hour is near, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

verses.name: Matthew 26:46
verses.text: Rise, let us go! Here comes my betrayer!"

verses.name: Matthew 26:47
verses.text: While he was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived. With him was a large crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests and the elders of the people.

verses.name: Matthew 26:48
verses.text: Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: "The one I kiss is the man; arrest him."

verses.name: Matthew 26:49
verses.text: Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, "Greetings, Rabbi!" and kissed him.

verses.name: Matthew 26:50
verses.text: Jesus replied, "Friend, do what you came for."

verses.name: Matthew 26:51
verses.text: Then the men stepped forward, seized Jesus and arrested him. With that, one of Jesus' companions reached for his sword, drew it out and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.

verses.name: Matthew 26:52
verses.text: "Put your sword back in its place," Jesus said to him, "for all who draw the sword will die by the sword.

verses.name: Matthew 26:53
verses.text: Do you think I cannot call on my Father, and he will at once put at my disposal more than twelve legions of angels?

verses.name: Matthew 26:54
verses.text: But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that say it must happen in this way?"

verses.name: Matthew 26:55
verses.text: At that time Jesus said to the crowd, "Am I leading a rebellion, that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me? Every day I sat in the temple courts teaching, and you did not arrest me.

verses.name: Matthew 26:56
verses.text: But this has all taken place that the writings of the prophets might be fulfilled." Then all the disciples deserted him and fled.

verses.name: Matthew 26:57
verses.text: Those who had arrested Jesus took him to Caiaphas, the high priest, where the teachers of the law and the elders had assembled.

verses.name: Matthew 26:58
verses.text: But Peter followed him at a distance, right up to the courtyard of the high priest. He entered and sat down with the guards to see the outcome.

verses.name: Matthew 26:59
verses.text: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for false evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death.

verses.name: Matthew 26:60
verses.text: But they did not find any, though many false witnesses came forward.

verses.name: Matthew 26:61
verses.text: Finally two came forward and declared, "This fellow said, 'I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.'"

verses.name: Matthew 26:62
verses.text: Then the high priest stood up and said to Jesus, "Are you not going to answer? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you?"

verses.name: Matthew 26:63
verses.text: But Jesus remained silent. The high priest said to him, "I charge you under oath by the living God: Tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God."

verses.name: Matthew 26:64
verses.text: "Yes, it is as you say," Jesus replied. "But I say to all of you: In the future you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven."

verses.name: Matthew 26:65
verses.text: Then the high priest tore his clothes and said, "He has spoken blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? Look, now you have heard the blasphemy.

verses.name: Matthew 26:66
verses.text: What do you think?He is worthy of death," they answered.

verses.name: Matthew 26:67
verses.text: Then they spit in his face and struck him with their fists. Others slapped him

verses.name: Matthew 26:68
verses.text: and said, "Prophesy to us, Christ. Who hit you?"

verses.name: Matthew 26:69
verses.text: Now Peter was sitting out in the courtyard, and a servant girl came to him. "You also were with Jesus of Galilee," she said.

verses.name: Matthew 26:70
verses.text: But he denied it before them all. "I don't know what you're talking about," he said.

verses.name: Matthew 26:71
verses.text: Then he went out to the gateway, where another girl saw him and said to the people there, "This fellow was with Jesus of Nazareth."

verses.name: Matthew 26:72
verses.text: He denied it again, with an oath: "I don't know the man!"

verses.name: Matthew 26:73
verses.text: After a little while, those standing there went up to Peter and said, "Surely you are one of them, for your accent gives you away."

verses.name: Matthew 26:74
verses.text: Then he began to call down curses on himself and he swore to them, "I don't know the man!"

verses.name: Matthew 26:75
verses.text: Immediately a rooster crowed. Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken: "Before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times." And he went outside and wept bitterly.

verses.name: Matthew 27:1
verses.text: Early in the morning, all the chief priests and the elders of the people came to the decision to put Jesus to death.

verses.name: Matthew 27:2
verses.text: They bound him, led him away and handed him over to Pilate, the governor.

verses.name: Matthew 27:3
verses.text: When Judas, who had betrayed him, saw that Jesus was condemned, he was seized with remorse and returned the thirty silver coins to the chief priests and the elders.

verses.name: Matthew 27:4
verses.text: "I have sinned," he said, "for I have betrayed innocent blood.What is that to us?" they replied. "That's your responsibility."

verses.name: Matthew 27:5
verses.text: So Judas threw the money into the temple and left. Then he went away and hanged himself.

verses.name: Matthew 27:6
verses.text: The chief priests picked up the coins and said, "It is against the law to put this into the treasury, since it is blood money."

verses.name: Matthew 27:7
verses.text: So they decided to use the money to buy the potter's field as a burial place for foreigners.

verses.name: Matthew 27:8
verses.text: That is why it has been called the Field of Blood to this day.

verses.name: Matthew 27:9
verses.text: Then what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled: "They took the thirty silver coins, the price set on him by the people of Israel,

verses.name: Matthew 27:10
verses.text: and they used them to buy the potter's field, as the Lord commanded me."

verses.name: Matthew 27:11
verses.text: Meanwhile Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, "Are you the king of the Jews?Yes, it is as you say," Jesus replied.

verses.name: Matthew 27:12
verses.text: When he was accused by the chief priests and the elders, he gave no answer.

verses.name: Matthew 27:13
verses.text: Then Pilate asked him, "Don't you hear the testimony they are bringing against you?"

verses.name: Matthew 27:14
verses.text: But Jesus made no reply, not even to a single charge--to the great amazement of the governor.

verses.name: Matthew 27:15
verses.text: Now it was the governor's custom at the Feast to release a prisoner chosen by the crowd.

verses.name: Matthew 27:16
verses.text: At that time they had a notorious prisoner, called Barabbas.

verses.name: Matthew 27:17
verses.text: So when the crowd had gathered, Pilate asked them, "Which one do you want me to release to you: Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?"

verses.name: Matthew 27:18
verses.text: For he knew it was out of envy that they had handed Jesus over to him.

verses.name: Matthew 27:19
verses.text: While Pilate was sitting on the judge's seat, his wife sent him this message: "Don't have anything to do with that innocent man, for I have suffered a great deal today in a dream because of him."

verses.name: Matthew 27:20
verses.text: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus executed.

verses.name: Matthew 27:21
verses.text: "Which of the two do you want me to release to you?" asked the governor. "Barabbas," they answered.

verses.name: Matthew 27:22
verses.text: "What shall I do, then, with Jesus who is called Christ?" Pilate asked. They all answered, "Crucify him!"

verses.name: Matthew 27:23
verses.text: "Why? What crime has he committed?" asked Pilate. But they shouted all the louder, "Crucify him!"

verses.name: Matthew 27:24
verses.text: When Pilate saw that he was getting nowhere, but that instead an uproar was starting, he took water and washed his hands in front of the crowd. "I am innocent of this man's blood," he said. "It is your responsibility!"

verses.name: Matthew 27:25
verses.text: All the people answered, "Let his blood be on us and on our children!"

verses.name: Matthew 27:26
verses.text: Then he released Barabbas to them. But he had Jesus flogged, and handed him over to be crucified.

verses.name: Matthew 27:27
verses.text: Then the governor's soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole company of soldiers around him.

verses.name: Matthew 27:28
verses.text: They stripped him and put a scarlet robe on him,

verses.name: Matthew 27:29
verses.text: and then twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on his head. They put a staff in his right hand and knelt in front of him and mocked him. "Hail, king of the Jews!" they said.

verses.name: Matthew 27:30
verses.text: They spit on him, and took the staff and struck him on the head again and again.

verses.name: Matthew 27:31
verses.text: After they had mocked him, they took off the robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.

verses.name: Matthew 27:32
verses.text: As they were going out, they met a man from Cyrene, named Simon, and they forced him to carry the cross.

verses.name: Matthew 27:33
verses.text: They came to a place called Golgotha (which means The Place of the Skull).

verses.name: Matthew 27:34
verses.text: There they offered Jesus wine to drink, mixed with gall; but after tasting it, he refused to drink it.

verses.name: Matthew 27:35
verses.text: When they had crucified him, they divided up his clothes by casting lots.

verses.name: Matthew 27:36
verses.text: And sitting down, they kept watch over him there.

verses.name: Matthew 27:37
verses.text: Above his head they placed the written charge against him: THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.name: Matthew 27:38
verses.text: Two robbers were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.

verses.name: Matthew 27:39
verses.text: Those who passed by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads

verses.name: Matthew 27:40
verses.text: and saying, "You who are going to destroy the temple and build it in three days, save yourself! Come down from the cross, if you are the Son of God!"

verses.name: Matthew 27:41
verses.text: In the same way the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders mocked him.

verses.name: Matthew 27:42
verses.text: "He saved others," they said, "but he can't save himself! He's the King of Israel! Let him come down now from the cross, and we will believe in him.

verses.name: Matthew 27:43
verses.text: He trusts in God. Let God rescue him now if he wants him, for he said, 'I am the Son of God.'"

verses.name: Matthew 27:44
verses.text: In the same way the robbers who were crucified with him also heaped insults on him.

verses.name: Matthew 27:45
verses.text: From the sixth hour until the ninth hour darkness came over all the land.

verses.name: Matthew 27:46
verses.text: About the ninth hour Jesus cried out in a loud voice, "Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?"--which means, "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?"

verses.name: Matthew 27:47
verses.text: When some of those standing there heard this, they said, "He's calling Elijah."

verses.name: Matthew 27:48
verses.text: Immediately one of them ran and got a sponge. He filled it with wine vinegar, put it on a stick, and offered it to Jesus to drink.

verses.name: Matthew 27:49
verses.text: The rest said, "Now leave him alone. Let's see if Elijah comes to save him."

verses.name: Matthew 27:50
verses.text: And when Jesus had cried out again in a loud voice, he gave up his spirit.

verses.name: Matthew 27:51
verses.text: At that moment the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom. The earth shook and the rocks split.

verses.name: Matthew 27:52
verses.text: The tombs broke open and the bodies of many holy people who had died were raised to life.

verses.name: Matthew 27:53
verses.text: They came out of the tombs, and after Jesus' resurrection they went into the holy city and appeared to many people.

verses.name: Matthew 27:54
verses.text: When the centurion and those with him who were guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and all that had happened, they were terrified, and exclaimed, "Surely he was the Son of God!"

verses.name: Matthew 27:55
verses.text: Many women were there, watching from a distance. They had followed Jesus from Galilee to care for his needs.

verses.name: Matthew 27:56
verses.text: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee's sons.

verses.name: Matthew 27:57
verses.text: As evening approached, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who had himself become a disciple of Jesus.

verses.name: Matthew 27:58
verses.text: Going to Pilate, he asked for Jesus' body, and Pilate ordered that it be given to him.

verses.name: Matthew 27:59
verses.text: Joseph took the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

verses.name: Matthew 27:60
verses.text: and placed it in his own new tomb that he had cut out of the rock. He rolled a big stone in front of the entrance to the tomb and went away.

verses.name: Matthew 27:61
verses.text: Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting there opposite the tomb.

verses.name: Matthew 27:62
verses.text: The next day, the one after Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees went to Pilate.

verses.name: Matthew 27:63
verses.text: "Sir," they said, "we remember that while he was still alive that deceiver said, 'After three days I will rise again.'

verses.name: Matthew 27:64
verses.text: So give the order for the tomb to be made secure until the third day. Otherwise, his disciples may come and steal the body and tell the people that he has been raised from the dead. This last deception will be worse than the first."

verses.name: Matthew 27:65
verses.text: "Take a guard," Pilate answered. "Go, make the tomb as secure as you know how."

verses.name: Matthew 27:66
verses.text: So they went and made the tomb secure by putting a seal on the stone and posting the guard.

verses.name: Matthew 28:1
verses.text: After the Sabbath, at dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to look at the tomb.

verses.name: Matthew 28:2
verses.text: There was a violent earthquake, for an angel of the Lord came down from heaven and, going to the tomb, rolled back the stone and sat on it.

verses.name: Matthew 28:3
verses.text: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothes were white as snow.

verses.name: Matthew 28:4
verses.text: The guards were so afraid of him that they shook and became like dead men.

verses.name: Matthew 28:5
verses.text: The angel said to the women, "Do not be afraid, for I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.

verses.name: Matthew 28:6
verses.text: He is not here; he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where he lay.

verses.name: Matthew 28:7
verses.text: Then go quickly and tell his disciples: 'He has risen from the dead and is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him.' Now I have told you."

verses.name: Matthew 28:8
verses.text: So the women hurried away from the tomb, afraid yet filled with joy, and ran to tell his disciples.

verses.name: Matthew 28:9
verses.text: Suddenly Jesus met them. "Greetings," he said. They came to him, clasped his feet and worshiped him.

verses.name: Matthew 28:10
verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, "Do not be afraid. Go and tell my brothers to go to Galilee; there they will see me."

verses.name: Matthew 28:11
verses.text: While the women were on their way, some of the guards went into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had happened.

verses.name: Matthew 28:12
verses.text: When the chief priests had met with the elders and devised a plan, they gave the soldiers a large sum of money,

verses.name: Matthew 28:13
verses.text: telling them, "You are to say, 'His disciples came during the night and stole him away while we were asleep.'

verses.name: Matthew 28:14
verses.text: If this report gets to the governor, we will satisfy him and keep you out of trouble."

verses.name: Matthew 28:15
verses.text: So the soldiers took the money and did as they were instructed. And this story has been widely circulated among the Jews to this very day.

verses.name: Matthew 28:16
verses.text: Then the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.

verses.name: Matthew 28:17
verses.text: When they saw him, they worshiped him; but some doubted.

verses.name: Matthew 28:18
verses.text: Then Jesus came to them and said, "All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.

verses.name: Matthew 28:19
verses.text: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

verses.name: Matthew 28:20
verses.text: and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age."
